post.description:
You can generate an API key and password in your XFE user
profile, or generate a new pair with this endpoint. The new
credentials are in the response object.

API keys and passwords do not expire. For example, the
following is usage of an API key/password with curl:

```
curl -u {apikey:password} https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/url/cnn.com
```
post.summary: Returns an API key and password pair which are needed when accessingthe API as an logged in user

get.description:
Returns a list of available api roots.
####  Curl Example:
```
curl -u {apikey:password} -H "Accept: application/vnd.oasis.taxii+json; version=2.0" https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/taxii
```
get.summary: Returns a discovery resource contains information about a TAXII Server

post.description:
This is the single endpoint for TAXII services. TAXII message must be transmitted via this endpoint over HTTPS. Available TAXII services are listed as follows:
TAXII Message Type Data Collection Description
Discovery Request

This message can be used to query all available TAXII services which XFE supports.
Collection Information Request

This message can be used to query all available TAXII data collections you have access.
Poll Request xfe.botnets

This TAXII data collection can be polled for all botnets.
xfe.default

This TAXII data collection can be polled for XFE default feed.
xfe.collections.public

This TAXII data collection can be polled for XFE public collections.

The result can be restricted to specific XFE collection by ID.

Collection ID:
xfe.collections.following

This TAXII data collection can be polled for XFE collections you are following.
xfe.collections.advisory

This TAXII data collection can be polled for XFE public advisories.
xfe.early_warning.hosts

This TAXII data collection can be polled for all Early Warning hosts. Access to this information is restricted to trial and enterprise users.
xfe.early_warning.threats

This TAXII data collection can be polled for all Early Warning threats. Access to this information is restricted to trial and enterprise users.
xfe.collectionById.{collectionId}

This type of TAXII data collections is used to poll one XFE collection you have access. A full list may be retrieved first using TAXII Collection Information Request.

Collection ID:
xfe.ipr

This TAXII data collection is used to query IP reputation report. You should set constraint to the IP address to query.

IP:
xfe.ipr.{category}

This kind of TAXII data collections can be polled for XFE IP reputation report in specific category. You should query for categories with access using TAXII Collection Information Request.
xfe.url

This TAXII data collection can be polled for XFE URL report. You should set constraint to the URL to query.

URL:
xfe.url.{category}

This set of TAXII data collections can be polled for XFE URL report in specific category. You should query for categories with access using TAXII Collection Information Request.
xfe.vulnerabilities

This TAXII data collection can be polled for XFE vulnerabilities information. You should set constraint to the vulnerability to query.

Vulnerability:
Inbox Message xfe.collectionInbox.{collectionId}

Inbox message against this set of TAXII data collection is used to modify XFE collection of specific collection ID. You should query for collection inboxes with access using TAXII Collection Information Request.

Collection ID:
For more information about TAXII, refer to https://taxii.mitre.org/.
post.summary: Trusted Automated eXchange of Indicator Information version 11

get.description:
Returns information contains title, description, TAXII versions and  maximum size of the content body.
####  Curl Example:
```
curl -u {apikey:password} -H "Accept: application/vnd.oasis.taxii+json; version=2.0" https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/taxii2
```
get.summary: Returns api root resource contains general information about the API Root

get.description:
Returns a list of public/private/shared collection resources which users have the access.
####  Curl Example:
```
curl -u {apikey:password} -H "Accept: application/vnd.oasis.taxii+json; version=2.0" https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/taxii2/collections
```
get.summary: Returns general information about all accessiable collections

get.description:
Returns general information about the collection, such as id, title, description, can_read, can_write and media_types.
{collectionID} must be in UUID format or 'public'. For example: d4ff8286-b4ed-38f7-0520-4cbfcf8216fa.
Collection ID 'public' is an pseudo-collection that contains objects for all public collections.
####  Curl Example:
```
curl -u {apikey:password} -H "Accept: application/vnd.oasis.taxii+json; version=2.0" https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/taxii2/collections/d4ff8286-b4ed-38f7-0520-4cbfcf8216fa
```
get.summary: Returns information for a specific collection

get.description:
Returns manifest information about all available objects. The information contains id, date_added and media_types.
{collectionID} must be in UUID format. For example: d4ff8286-b4ed-38f7-0520-4cbfcf8216fa.
####  Curl Example:
```
curl -u {apikey:password} -H "Accept: application/vnd.oasis.taxii+json; version=2.0" https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/taxii2/collections/d4ff8286-b4ed-38f7-0520-4cbfcf8216fa/manifest
```

parameters.description: Filter the result set to only include the items added after the specified time. For example: 2019-04-29T10:07:38.165Z
parameters.name: added_after

parameters.description: Filter the result set to only include the items added before the specified time. For example: 2019-04-29T10:07:38.165Z
parameters.name: added_before

get.summary: Returns manifest about objects from a Collection

get.description:
Retrive all avaiable objects in a Collection.
{collectionID} must be in UUID format. For example: d4ff8286-b4ed-38f7-0520-4cbfcf8216fa.
####  Curl Example:
```
curl -u {apikey:password} -H "Accept: application/vnd.oasis.stix+json; version=2.0" https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/taxii2/collections/d4ff8286-b4ed-38f7-0520-4cbfcf8216fa/objects
```

parameters.description: Filter the result set to only include the items added after the specified time. For example: 2019-04-29T10:07:38.165Z
parameters.name: added_after

parameters.description: Filter the result set to only include the items added before the specified time. For example: 2019-04-29T10:07:38.165Z
parameters.name: added_before

get.summary: Returns objects information from a collection

get.description:
Returns general information for the specific object in one collection.
####  Curl Example:
```
curl -u {apikey:password} -H "Accept: application/vnd.oasis.stix+json; version=2.0" https://api.xforce.ibmcloud.com/taxii2/collections/d4ff8286-b4ed-38f7-0520-4cbfcf8216fa/objects/indicator--4387a7a4-67d4-33d5-58fb-59bfad9c17a3
```
get.summary: Returns an object from a Collection by object id

This is the TAXII 2 root information endpointYou can specify your response type with the Accept header TAXII 20 Accept applicationvndoasistaxiijson version20 or Accept applicationvndoasistaxiijson TAXII 21 Accept applicationvndoasistaxiijson version21

post.description:
This is the endpoint for TAXII services for Advanced Threat Protection Feed. TAXII message must be transmitted via this endpoint over HTTPS. Available TAXII services are listed as follows:
TAXII Message Type Data Collection Description
Discovery Request

This message can be used to query all available TAXII services which XFE supports.
Collection Information Request

This message can be used to query all available TAXII data collections you have access.
Poll Request xfti.c2server.ipv4

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv4s related to Botnet Command and Control Server.
xfti.c2server.ipv6

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv6s related to Botnet Command and Control Server.
xfti.c2server.url

This TAXII data collection can be polled for URLs related to Botnet Command and Control Server.
xfti.bots.ipv4

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv4s related to Bots.
xfti.bots.ipv6

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv6s related to Bots.
xfti.phishing.url

This TAXII data collection can be polled for URLs related to Phishing URLs.
xfti.anonsvcs.ipv4

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv4s related to Anonymization Services.
xfti.anonsvcs.ipv6

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv6s related to Anonymization Services.
xfti.anonsvcs.url

This TAXII data collection can be polled for URLs related to Anonymization Services.
xfti.cryptomining.ipv4

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv4s related to Cryptocurrency Mining.
xfti.cryptomining.ipv6

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv6s related to Cryptocurrency Mining.
xfti.cryptomining.url

This TAXII data collection can be polled for URLs related to Cryptocurrency Mining.
xfti.scanning.ipv4

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv4s related to Scanning IPs.
xfti.scanning.ipv6

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv6s related to Scanning IPs.
xfti.ew.url

This TAXII data collection can be polled for URLs related to Early Warning.
xfti.mw.ipv4

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv4s related to Malware.
xfti.mw.ipv6

This TAXII data collection can be polled for IPv6s related to Malware.
xfti.mw.url

This TAXII data collection can be polled for URLs related to Malware.
xfti.topact.url.10k

This TAXII data collection can be polled for the top hundred thousand URLs rated by activity as known by X-Force Exchange.
For more information about TAXII, refer to https://taxii.mitre.org/.
post.summary: Trusted Automated eXchange of Indicator Information version 11
